intro: Euphorbia kralickii, commonly known as the Kralický euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to the Czech Republic. It is characterized by its dense, spiny stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of yellow. The plant has adapted to arid conditions with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience. However, it contains toxic sap, so handling requires caution.
